intro: Oligochaetochilus terminalis, commonly known as the terminal slender moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, delicate stems and small, overlapping leaves that are typically green to reddish in color. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on specialized shoots called setae. Oligochaetochilus terminalis plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
